required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Three-dimensional Cleft Lip and Palate Morphology Prior to One-stage Cleft Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Collaborative, Comparative Study on Three-dimensional Cleft Lip and Palate Morphology Prior to One-stage Cleft Repair (Warsaw/Basel)

collaborator.agency: Institute of Mother and Child, Warsaw, Poland

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational cohort study of consecutive patients with cleft lip and palate deformity undergoing cleft repair at the Institute of Mother and Child in Warsaw. Cleft morphology will be captured with photo and intraoral camera before routine surgery at around 8 months. Furthermore, wound healing at 3 months postoperative will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: True Cleft Area in mm2 of Newborns With Cleft Lip and Palate at 8 Month of Age
primary_outcome.time_frame: Capture of the cleft morphology with photo and intraoral camera before routine surgery at around 8 months.
primary_outcome.description: True cleft area in mm2 will be measured at 8 month of age in newborns with cleft lip and palate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cleft Width and Height in mm of Newborns With Cleft Lip and Palate at 8 Month of Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Capture of the cleft morphology with photo and intraoral camera before routine surgery at around 8 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the width and height in mm of the cleft measured at 8 months of age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound Healing (fistula yes or no) 3 Months After One-Stage Cleft Repair
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of wound healing by fistula formation at 3 months postoperative

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of Cleft Width in mm and Wound Healing after One-Stage Cleft Repair
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At surgery and at 3 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the correlation between cleft width in mm and wound healing

study_pop.textblock: Patients eligible for this study must have an orofacial cleft which has to be treated around the age of 6-15 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with orofacial cleft, who undergo routine cleft repair
Exclusion Criteria:
- missing datasets
- no signed consent for research

overall_official.affiliation: University and University Hospital of Basel
Maxillo-facial Surgery Unit, Pediatric Surgery Clinic, Institute of Mother and Child
